content: How can I help you today?

I've just been having a really hard time sleeping lately. My thoughts keep racing, especially about work and how things might go wrong. It’s affecting how I feel day to day, and honestly, I’m not sure what to do about it.

That sounds really tough to deal with, especially when it’s affecting your daily life. Sometimes when worries pile up, it can be hard to find peace, even at night. What's been on your mind most about work?

I’m just really worried about losing my job. Things haven’t been going well, and I feel like if layoffs happen, I might be one of the first to go. It’s just been constant stress, and I keep thinking about how I’m going to provide for my family if that happens. It’s like I can’t turn my brain off at night.

You're carrying a lot of responsibility and worry, especially about your job and providing for your family. It’s understandable that thinking about losing your job would feel overwhelming, especially since it's tied to your family’s well-being. How have these thoughts impacted your day-to-day life outside of work?

It’s been exhausting, honestly. I feel drained all the time because I’m not sleeping well, and I worry it’s affecting how I’m showing up for my kids and my partner. I just don’t feel like myself anymore, and that’s upsetting too.

It sounds like this stress is weighing heavily, not just on how you feel physically but on how you see yourself in your relationships. Feeling disconnected from yourself can be really upsetting. How do you usually manage stress when it starts to build like this?

I don’t think I’ve been managing it well. At night, I usually end up scrolling on my phone to distract myself, but it makes it worse because I just end up with more thoughts running through my head. Honestly, I feel stuck—I don’t know how to stop the cycle.

It seems like you're trying to distract yourself, but instead, it’s feeding into the cycle and making things harder for you. Feeling stuck in patterns like that can be really discouraging, and it shows how much this matters to you to want things to change. What do you think would make a difference for you if you could break out of this cycle?

I’m not really sure what would help. I guess if I could find a way to actually wind down at night and not overthink so much, that would make a difference. But I don’t even know where to start with that. It feels like my brain just doesn’t have an off switch.

It sounds like finding a way to truly unwind and quiet your thoughts could be a relief for you. The mental overload you're feeling right now must be really draining. What’s something, even small, that helps you feel calm during the day—or has worked for you in the past when things got overwhelming?

Well, I honestly haven’t figured out what calms me down lately. In the past, I’d go for walks or listen to music, but these days, I don’t even feel like I have the energy to do those things. It’s like everything feels overwhelming, even the stuff that's supposed to help.

It sounds like even the things that once helped you feel grounded are harder to reach right now, and that’s adding to the overwhelm. It’s tough when you don’t feel you have the energy for the things that could bring relief. What do you think has been keeping you from finding that energy or motivation?

I think it’s just the stress weighing me down. It’s hard to want to do anything when my mind feels stuck in all these “what if” scenarios, especially about work. It’s like I’m too drained from worrying to even take a step back and do something for myself.

The constant stress and worrying about all the "what ifs" seem to be taking up so much of your energy that there's little left for taking care of yourself. That sounds exhausting, and it says a lot about how much you care—not just about work, but about the people who rely on you. What would it be like for you to make space, even briefly, to focus on yourself instead of all those worries?

Honestly, it’s hard to even imagine doing that right now. My mind just feels so caught up in everything I have to worry about that it feels like there’s no space for me. Maybe I’d feel a little less drained if I could actually let go of some of this stress, but I don’t know how to start.

Letting go of some of that stress feels like it could give you the breathing room you need, but figuring out where to start when you're carrying so much can be overwhelming in itself. Is there something small—just one thing—you could try today or tonight to shift focus even a little toward your own well-being?

Maybe I could try putting my phone down earlier at night, but honestly, that feels easier said than done—it’s the only thing that distracts me. I don’t know if I can stick to it, but I guess I could try to set a limit for myself. Do you think that could help, or is there something else I should try instead?

Setting a limit with your phone could be a good first step, especially since you’ve noticed it contributes to feeling more overwhelmed. Starting small, like choosing a specific time to put it aside, might feel easier to manage. It’s great that you’re open to trying something—it shows you’re exploring ways to care for yourself, even when it feels challenging. Would you like to talk more about realistic ways to begin making space for yourself?
I think I’m okay to end the conversation. Thank you for speaking about this with me.
